self.philbrown.AbLE
Class AbLEActivity

java.lang.Object
  Activity
      self.philbrown.AbLE.AbLEActivity

public class AbLEActivity
extends Activity

This activity uses AbLE to create layouts from annotated java code.

Author:
Phil Brown

Method Detail

onCreate

public void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState)

getContentLocationOnScreen

public static void getContentLocationOnScreen(int[] out)
Returns the location of the contentView within the screen. This is different from the screen size when the developer specifies a custom screen size in the application meta-data

Parameters:
out - the array in which to place the location x and y coordinates, respectively.

isScreenSizeCustomized

public static boolean isScreenSizeCustomized()
Returns:
true if the developer has specified a custom screen size in the application meta-data

getCustomWidth

public static int getCustomWidth()
Returns:
the developer-customized screen width, or 0 if not specified.

getCustomHeight

public static int getCustomHeight()
Returns:
the developer-customized screen height, or 0 if not specified.

isKeyboardVisible

public boolean isKeyboardVisible()

hideKeyboard

public void hideKeyboard()
Hides the keyboard if it is open

showKeyboard

public void showKeyboard()
Shows the keyboard if it is closed

getKeyboardHeight

public int getKeyboardHeight()
Returns:
the estimated height of the keyboard, or 0 if unknown.

recursivelyFindViewById

public View recursivelyFindViewById(int id,
                                    View v)
Recursively iterates through all views and view children in the layout to look for a view with the given id.

Parameters:
id - the id of the view in question
v - the view whose id to check, or whose children id's to check
Returns:
the view in the layout with the given id, or null if it was not found.

findViewById

public View findViewById(int id)
This is a replacement for Activity#findViewById(int), that handles the id query based on the annotations-based layout scheme.

Parameters:
id - the view id for which to query
Returns:
the view with the given id, or null if no view with that id is found in the layout.

addListener

public static void addListener(ActivityListener listener)
Adds a listener to listeners. This does not check for multiple instances of listeners.

Parameters:
listener -

removeListener

public static void removeListener(ActivityListener listener)
Removes the listener. Good idea to call this before a listener is nullified.

Parameters:
listener -

isListenerRegistered

public static boolean isListenerRegistered(ActivityListener listener)
Checks to see if the given listener is already registered to receive callbacks

Parameters:
listener - the listener to check
Returns:
true if listener is registered. Otherwise, false.

hideStatusbar

public void hideStatusbar()
Dims the status bar.

killProcess

public void killProcess()
Kill the application. This can be used for cases where Objects in static layout files reference variables that will be nullified when the application closes - but are not reset by the VM.

convertDpToPixel

public float convertDpToPixel(float dp)
This method convets dp unit to equivalent device specific value in pixels.

Parameters:
dp - A value in dp(Device independent pixels) unit. Which we need to convert into pixels
context - Context to get resources and device specific display metrics
Returns:
A float value to represent Pixels equivalent to dp according to device

convertPixelsToDp

public float convertPixelsToDp(float px)
This method converts raw pixel value to device specific pixels.

Parameters:
px - A value in px (pixels) unit. Which we need to convert into db
context - Context to get resources and device specific display metrics
Returns:
A float value to represent db equivalent to px value

Converts device raw pixels to device independent pixels

Returns:
